headline: Retail winners & losers as Black Friday nears
summary: As Black Friday approaches, retail stocks are on the move with earnings reports released Tuesday for major retailers including Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS), Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF), and Best Buy (BBY). Strategic Resource Group Founder Burt Flickinger joins Asking for a Trend Host Josh Lipton to break down the retail winners and losers, consumer behavior, and broader industry trends. Flickinger underscores that in a challenging retail environment, where consumers are increasingly budget-conscious, the winners are going to be “necessary” retailers in the food sector, like Kroger (KR) and Costco (COST). Tune in to the video above for more insights into the shopping trends shaping the year ahead. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Cindy Mizaku.

Flickinger underscores that in a challenging retail environment, where consumers are increasingly budget-conscious, the winners are going to be “necessary” retailers in the food sector, like Kroger (KR) and Costco (COST). headline: Why Best Buy (BBY) Stock Is Falling Today
summary: Shares of electronics retailer Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) fell 10.3% in the morning session after the company reported weak third-quarter results, which missed analysts' revenue and earnings expectations. It also added fuel to the fire by lowering its full-year revenue and EPS guidance. headline: Best Buy stock slides on Q3 miss citing weak consumer demand
summary: Best Buy (BBY) stock slides lower Tuesday morning after reporting third quarter results that underperformed estimates, revealing $9.44 billion in revenue and adjusted earnings of $1.26 per share. The electronics retailer went on to cut its full-year sales forecast, citing weakened demand for consumer electronics in the past quarter. Seana Smith and Brad Smith review the store's latest earnings print ahead of the incoming holiday shopping season. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Best Buy reports another quarterly sales decline as shoppers pull back spending on gadgets
summary: Best Buy, the nation’s largest consumer electronics chain, on Tuesday reported another quarterly drop in sales as Americans continued to tighten their purse strings on appliances and gadgets to focus on essentials.  The Richfield, Minnesota-based retailer lowered its annual sales and profit outlook, sending its shares down 2.6% in premarket trading.  The company reported earnings of $273 million, or $1.26 per share, for the quarter ended Nov. 2.

The company reported earnings of $273 million, or $1.26 per share, for the quarter ended Nov. 2.

headline: Best Buy Says Q3 Sales 'Little Softer Than Expected' On Lower Demand For Appliances And Gaming, Trims Annual Forecast
summary: On Tuesday, Best Buy Co., Inc (NYSE:BBY) reported fiscal 2025 third-quarter adjusted EPS of $1.26, missing the consensus of $1.29. Enterprise comparable sales fell 2.9%. Quarterly sales decreased to $9.45 billion from $9.76 billion a year ago, missing the analyst consensus of $9.63 billion. headline: Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) Misses Q3 Sales Targets, Stock Drops
summary: Electronics retailer Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2024, with sales falling 3.2% year on year to $9.45 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $41.3 billion at the midpoint came in 0.7% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.26 per share was 2.5% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) Misses Q3 Sales Targets, Stock Drops
raw.summary: Electronics retailer Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2024, with sales falling 3.2% year on year to $9.45 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $41.3 billion at the midpoint came in 0.7% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.26 per share was 2.5% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Best Buy annual forecasts take a knock from weak electronics demand
summary: (Reuters) -Best Buy trimmed its annual forecasts and joined a host of U.S. retailers in signaling a promotion-heavy holiday sales season, as customers remain cautious about spending on big-ticket items such as televisions and home theater systems.  Its shares fell 9% at the open on Tuesday as a drop in third-quarter comparable sales was much bigger than expected.  "We expected lower demand between sales events, but the impact was steeper than expected," CEO Corie Barry said on an earnings call, echoing Target executives' comments that the response to promotions this year was stronger than earlier.

raw.headline: Best Buy annual forecasts take a knock from weak electronics demand
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Best Buy trimmed its annual forecasts and joined a host of U.S. retailers in signaling a promotion-heavy holiday sales season, as customers remain cautious about spending on big-ticket items such as televisions and home theater systems.  Its shares fell 9% at the open on Tuesday as a drop in third-quarter comparable sales was much bigger than expected.  "We expected lower demand between sales events, but the impact was steeper than expected," CEO Corie Barry said on an earnings call, echoing Target executives' comments that the response to promotions this year was stronger than earlier.
